org.corfudb.runtime.protocols

Interface IServerProtocol

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IConfigMaster, ISimpleSequencer, IStreamSequencer, IWriteOnceLogUnit
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CorfuDBConfigMasterProtocol, CorfuDBSimpleLogUnitProtocol, CorfuDBSimpleSequencerProtocol, CorfuDBStreamingSequencerProtocol, MemoryConfigMasterProtocol, MemoryLogUnitProtocol, MemorySequencerProtocol, RedisLogUnitProtocol, RedisSequencerProtocol

    public interface IServerProtocol
    This interface represents the minimum APIs a server protocol must implement.
    Author:
    Michael Wei

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.slf4j.Logger log 
      static Pattern r

    • Field Detail

      • log

        static final org.slf4j.Logger log

      • r

        static final Pattern r

    • Method Detail

      • getProtocolString

        static String getProtocolString()
        Returns the protocol string for this server protocol. For example, the protocol string for the hypertext transport protocol is "http".

      • protocolFactory

        static IServerProtocol protocolFactory(Class<? extends IServerProtocol> factoryClass,
                                       String serverString,
                                       long epoch)
                                throws IllegalAccessException,
                                       NoSuchMethodException,
                                       InvocationTargetException
        Returns a new instance of this protocol, given a host, port and the server string.
        Parameters:
        fullstring - The full server string. This may contain special options, etc.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the protocol.
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException
        NoSuchMethodException
        InvocationTargetException

      • protocolFactory

        static IServerProtocol protocolFactory(String host,
                                       Integer port,
                                       Map<String,String> options,
                                       long epoch)
        Returns a new instance of this protocol, given a parsed host,port and optionmap. Any class that implements this interface must implement and override this function.
        Parameters:
        host - The hostname of the server.
        port - The port number of the server.
        options - A map containing the options to pass to the server.
        epoch - The epoch this server must be in.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the protocol.

      • getMatchesFromServerString

        static Matcher getMatchesFromServerString(String serverString)
        Returns a matcher containing the parsed groups from the server string.
        Parameters:
        serverString - A server string to parse
        Returns:
        A matcher with the groups parsed from the regex.

      • getFullString

        default String getFullString()
        Returns the full server string.
        Returns:
        A server string.

      • getHost

        String getHost()
        Returns the host
        Returns:
        The hostname for the server.

      • getPort

        Integer getPort()
        Returns the port
        Returns:
        The port number of the server.

      • getOptions

        Map<String,String> getOptions()
        Returns the option map
        Returns:
        The option map for the server.

      • ping

        boolean ping()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the server was reachable.
        Returns:
        True if the server was reachable, false otherwise.

      • setEpoch

        void setEpoch(long epoch)
        Sets the epoch of the server. Used by the configuration master to switch epochs.

      • reset

        void reset(long epoch)
    throws NetworkException
        Resets the server. Used by the configuration master to reset the state of the server. Should eliminate ALL hard state!
        Throws:
        NetworkException

      • simulateFailure

        default void simulateFailure(boolean fail)
        Simulates a failure by causing the node to not respond. If not implemented, will throw an UnsupportedOperation exception.
        Parameters:
        fail - True, to simulate failure, False, to restore the unit to responsiveness.

      • simulateFailure

        default void simulateFailure(boolean fail,
                             long length)
        Simulate a transient or permanent failure, causing the node to not respond. If not implemented, will throw an UnsupportedOperation exception.
        Parameters:
        fail - True, to simulate failure, False, to restore the unit to responsiveness.
        length - The amount of time to simulate the failure, if fail is set to True, or -1 for a permanent failure.
